verses.verse: And it came to pass<WH1961>, that when Isaac<WH3327> was old<WH2204>, and his eyes<WH5869> were dim<WH3543>, so that he could not see<WH7200>, he called<WH7121> Esau<WH6215> his oldest<WH1419> son<WH1121>, and said<WH559> unto him<WH1121>, My son: and he said unto him<WH559>, Behold, here am I.
And he said<WH559>, Behold now<WH2204>, I am old, I know<WH3045> not the day<WH3117> of my death<WH4194>:
Now therefore take<WH5375>, I pray you your weapons<WH3627>, your quiver<WH8522> and your bow<WH7198>, and go out<WH3318> to the field<WH7704>, and take<WH6679> me some venison<WH6718>;
And make<WH6213> me savory meat<WH4303>, such as<WH834> I love<WH157>, and bring<WH935> it to me<WH398>, that I may eat; that my soul<WH5315> may bless<WH1288> you before<WH2962> I die<WH4191>.

And Rebekah<WH7259> heard<WH8085> when Isaac<WH3327> spoke<WH1696> to Esau<WH6215> his son<WH1121>. And Esau<WH6215> went<WH3212> to the field<WH7704> to hunt<WH6679> for venison<WH6718>, and to bring it<WH935>.
And Rebekah<WH7259> spoke<WH559> unto Jacob<WH3290> her son<WH1121>, saying<WH559>, Behold<WH8085>, I heard your father<WH1> speak<WH1696> unto Esau<WH6215> your brother<WH251>, saying<WH559>,
Bring<WH935> me venison<WH6718>, and make<WH6213> me savory meat<WH4303>, that I may eat<WH398>, and bless<WH1288> you before<WH6440> the Lord<WH3068> before<WH6440> my death<WH4194>.
Now therefore<WH1121>, my son, obey<WH8085> my voice<WH6963> according to that which<WH834> I command you<WH6680>

Go<WH3212> now to the flock<WH6629>, and fetch<WH3947> me from there two<WH8147> good<WH2896> kids<WH1423> of the goats<WH5795>; and I will make<WH6213> them savory meat<WH4303> for your father<WH1>, such as he loves<WH157>:
And you shall bring<WH935> it to your father<WH1>, that he may eat<WH398>, and that<WH834> he may bless<WH1288> you before<WH6440> his death<WH4194>.
And Jacob<WH3290> said<WH559> to Rebekah<WH7259> his mother<WH517>, Behold<WH6215>, Esau my brother<WH251> is a hairy<WH8163> man<WH376>, and I am a smooth<WH2509> man<WH376>:
My father<WH1> probably will feel<WH4959> me<WH5869>, and I shall seem to him as a deceiver<WH8591>; and I shall bring<WH935> a curse<WH7045> upon me<WH1293>, and not a blessing.
And his mother<WH517> said<WH559> unto him<WH7045>, Upon me be your curse, my son<WH1121>: only obey<WH8085> my voice<WH6963>, and go<WH3212> fetch me them<WH3947>.
And he went<WH3212>, and fetched<WH3947>, and brought<WH935> them to his mother<WH517>: and his mother<WH517> made<WH6213> savory meat<WH4303>, such as his father<WH1> loved<WH157>.

And Rebekah<WH7259> took<WH3947> the good<WH2532> clothes<WH899> of her eldest<WH1419> son<WH1121> Esau<WH6215>, which were with her in the house<WH1004>, and put them upon<WH3847> Jacob<WH3290> her younger<WH6996> son<WH1121>:
And she put<WH3847> the skins<WH5785> of the kids<WH1423> of the goats<WH5795> upon his hands<WH3027>, and upon the smooth<WH2513> of his neck<WH6677>:
And she gave<WH5414> the savory meat<WH4303> and the bread<WH3899>, which she had prepared<WH6213>, into the hand<WH3027> of her son<WH1121> Jacob<WH3290>.
And he came<WH935> unto his father<WH1>, and said<WH559>, My father<WH1>: and he said<WH559>, Here am I<WH1121>; who are you my son?

And Jacob<WH3290> said<WH559> unto his father<WH1>, I am Esau<WH6215> your firstborn<WH1060>; I have done<WH6213> according as you told<WH1696> me<WH6965>: arise, I pray you sit<WH3427> and eat<WH398> of my venison<WH6718>, that your soul<WH5315> may bless me<WH1288>.

And Isaac<WH3327> said<WH559> unto his son<WH1121>, How is it that you have found<WH4672> it so quickly<WH4116>, my son<WH1121>? And he said<WH559>, Because the Lord<WH3068> your God<WH430> brought<WH7136> it to me<WH6440>.
And Isaac<WH3327> said<WH559> unto Jacob<WH3290>, Come near<WH5066>, I pray you that I may feel<WH4184> you my son<WH1121>, whether you be my very<WH2088> son<WH1121> Esau or not<WH6215>.

And Jacob<WH3290> went near<WH5066> unto Isaac<WH3327> his father<WH1>; and he felt<WH4959> him<WH559>, and said, The voice<WH6963> is Jacob<WH3290>'s voice<WH6963>, but the hands<WH3027> are the hands<WH3027> of Esau<WH6215>.
And he discerned<WH5234> him not<WH3027>, because his hands were hairy<WH8163>, as his brother<WH251> Esau<WH6215>'s hands<WH3027>: so he blessed him<WH1288>.
And he said<WH559>, are you my very son<WH1121> Esau<WH6215>? And he said<WH559>, I am.

And he said<WH559>, Bring it near<WH5066> to me<WH398>, and I will eat of my son<WH1121>'s venison<WH6718>, that my soul<WH5315> may bless<WH1288> you And he brought it near<WH5066> to him<WH398>, and he did eat: and he brought<WH935> him wine<WH3196>, and he drank<WH8354>.
And his father<WH1> Isaac<WH3327> said<WH559> unto him<WH5066>, Come near now<WH5401>, and kiss me<WH1121>, my son.

And he came near<WH5066>, and kissed<WH5401> him<WH7306>: and he smelled the smell<WH7381> of his clothes<WH899>, and blessed<WH1288> him<WH559>, and said, See<WH7200>, the smell<WH7381> of my son<WH1121> is as the smell<WH7381> of a field<WH7704> which the Lord<WH3068> has blessed<WH1288>:
Therefore God<WH430> give<WH5414> you of the dew<WH2919> of heaven<WH8064>, and the fatness<WH4924> of the earth<WH776>, and plenty<WH7230> of corn<WH1715> and wine<WH8492>:

Let people<WH5971> serve<WH5647> you and nations<WH3816> bow down<WH7812> to you be<WH1933> lord<WH1376> over your brothers<WH251>, and let your mother<WH517>'s sons<WH1121> bow down<WH7812> to you cursed<WH779> be every one that curses<WH779> you and blessed<WH1288> be he that blesses you<WH1288>

And it came to pass<WH3327>, as soon as Isaac had made an end<WH3615> of blessing<WH1288> Jacob<WH3290>, and Jacob<WH3290> was yet<WH389> scarce<WH3318> gone out<WH3318> from the presence<WH6440> of Isaac<WH3327> his father<WH1>, that Esau<WH6215> his brother<WH251> came in<WH935> from his hunting<WH6718>.

And he also had made<WH6213> savory meat<WH4303>, and brought it<WH935> unto his father<WH1>, and said<WH559> unto his father<WH1>, Let my father<WH1> arise<WH6965>, and eat<WH398> of his son<WH1121>'s venison<WH6718>, that your soul<WH5315> may bless me<WH1288>.
And Isaac<WH3327> his father<WH1> said<WH559> unto him<WH559>, Who are you And he said, I am your son<WH1121>, your firstborn<WH1060> Esau<WH6215>.

And Isaac<WH3327> trembled<WH2729> very<WH1419> violently<WH3966>, and said<WH559>, Who<WH645>? Where is he that has taken<WH6679> venison<WH6718>, and brought<WH935> it me<WH398>, and I have eaten of all before you came<WH935>, and have blessed<WH1288> him<WH1288>? Yes and he shall be blessed.

And when Esau<WH6215> heard<WH8085> the words<WH1697> of his father<WH1>, he cried<WH6817> with a great<WH1419> and exceedingly<WH3966> bitter<WH4751> cry<WH6818>, and said<WH559> unto his father<WH1>, Bless<WH1288> me<WH1>, even me also, O my father.
And he said<WH559>, your brother<WH251> came<WH935> with deceit<WH4820>, and has taken away<WH3947> your blessing<WH1293>.

And he said<WH559>, Is not he rightly<WH3588> named<WH7121> Jacob<WH3290>? for he has supplanted me<WH6117> these<WH2088> two times<WH6471>: he took away<WH3947> my birthright<WH1062>; and<WH3947>, behold, now he has taken away my blessing<WH1293>. And he said<WH559>, have you not reserved<WH680> a blessing for me<WH1293>?

And Isaac<WH3327> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559> unto Esau<WH6215>, Behold<WH7760>, I have made him your lord<WH1376>, and all his brothers<WH251> have I given<WH5414> to him for servants<WH5650>; and with corn<WH1715> and wine<WH8492> have I sustained<WH5564> him<WH6213>: and what shall I do now<WH645> unto you my son<WH1121>?

And Esau<WH6215> said<WH559> unto his father<WH1>, have you but one<WH259> blessing<WH1293>, my father<WH1>? bless<WH1288> me<WH1>, even me also, O my father. And Esau<WH6215> lifted up<WH5375> his voice<WH6963>, and wept<WH1058>.

And Isaac<WH3327> his father<WH1> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559> unto him<WH4186>, Behold, your living shall be the fatness<WH4924> of the earth<WH776>, and of the dew<WH2919> of heaven<WH8064> from above<WH5920>;

And by your sword<WH2719> shall you live<WH2421>, and shall serve<WH5647> your brother<WH251>; and it shall come to pass when you shall have the dominion<WH7300>, that you shall break<WH6561> his yoke<WH5923> from off your neck<WH6677>.

And Esau<WH6215> hated<WH7852> Jacob<WH3290> because<WH5921> of the blessing<WH1293> with which<WH834> his father<WH1> blessed him<WH1288>: and Esau<WH6215> said<WH559> in his heart<WH3820>, The days<WH3117> of mourning<WH60> for my father<WH1> are at hand<WH7126>; then will I kill<WH2026> my brother<WH251> Jacob<WH3290>.

And these words<WH1697> of Esau<WH6215> her elder<WH1419> son<WH1121> were told<WH5046> to Rebekah<WH7259>: and she sent<WH7971> and called<WH7121> Jacob<WH3290> her younger<WH6996> son<WH1121>, and said<WH559> unto him<WH251>, Behold, your brother Esau<WH6215>, as touching you does comfort<WH5162> himself<WH2026>, purposing to kill you
Now therefore<WH1121>, my son, obey<WH8085> my voice<WH6963>; and arise<WH6965>, flee<WH1272> you to Laban<WH3837> my brother<WH251> to Haran<WH2771>;
And stay<WH3427> with him a few<WH259> days<WH3117>, until<WH834> your brother<WH251>'s fury<WH2534> turn away<WH7725>;

Until your brother<WH251>'s anger<WH639> turn away<WH7725> from you and he forget<WH7911> that which you have done<WH6213> to him<WH7971>: then I will send, and fetch<WH3947> you from there why<WH4100> should I be deprived<WH7921> also of you both<WH8147> in one<WH259> day<WH3117>?

And Rebekah<WH7259> said<WH559> to Isaac<WH3327>, I am weary<WH6973> of my life<WH2416> because<WH6440> of the daughters<WH1323> of Heth<WH2845>: if Jacob<WH3290> take<WH3947> a wife<WH802> of the daughters<WH1323> of Heth<WH2845>, such as these which are of the daughters<WH1323> of the land<WH776>, what good<WH4100> shall my life do me<WH2416>?
